name: Accessible walk to Broomhill Point, North Lakes Outdoors

ai.summary: A 9.2 km moderate hike from North Lakes Outdoors to Broomhill Point, combining coastal and lakeside scenery. The route is accessible to most walkers with steady footing and a reasonable level of fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain includes coastal paths, lakeside trails, compact gravel and occasional boardwalks. Expect uneven ground, gentle gradients, and potential mud or slippery surfaces after rain or near the shoreline.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather forecast before starting; coastal sections can be affected by tides. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring a lightweight waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths; watch for uneven ground, roots and loose gravel. Carry a map or GPS and ensure your phone is charged. Tell someone your plan and expected return time. Stay hydrated, carry snacks, and be prepared for sudden weather changes; in exposed sections, protect against wind chill and sun exposure.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for drier, more predictable conditions and longer daylight; summer offers the best visibility, while winter can be exposed with stronger winds and slip hazards.
